title: Strengthening of international cooperation and coordination of efforts to study, mitigate and minimize the consequences of the Chornobyl disaster
text:
United Nations 
A/80/L.35
 
 
General Assembly 
Distr.: Limited 
8 December 2025 
Original: English 
 
25-20156 (E)    091225     
*2520156* 
 
 
Eightieth session 
Agenda item 72 (d) 
Strengthening of the coordination of humanitarian and 
disaster relief assistance of the United Nations, including 
special economic assistance: strengthening of international 
cooperation and coordination of efforts to study, mitigate 
and minimize the consequences of the Chernobyl disaster 
 
 
 
 
 
Belarus:* amendment to draft resolution A/80/L.27  
 
 
 
 Strengthening of international cooperation and coordination of 
efforts to study, mitigate and minimize the consequences of the 
Chornobyl disaster 
 
 
1.  
Replace “Chornobyl” with “Chernobyl” in the title, the preambular paragraphs 
and the operative paragraphs. 
2.  
In the second preambular paragraph, delete “of Ukraine”. 
3.  
In operative paragraph 1, replace “Welcomes” with “Takes note of”. 
4.  
Delete operative paragraphs 5, 6, 10 and 13. 
5.  
In operative paragraph 14, replace “Strengthening of international cooperation 
and coordination of efforts to study, mitigate and minimize the consequences of the 
Chornobyl disaster” with “Strengthening of international cooperation and 
coordination of efforts to study, mitigate and minimize the consequences of the 
Chernobyl disaster”. 
 
 
 
* Any changes to the list of sponsors will be reflected in the official record of the meeting.

paragraphs.1: Replace “Chornobyl” with “Chernobyl” in the title, the preambular paragraphs and the operative paragraphs.
paragraphs.2: In the second preambular paragraph, delete “of Ukraine”.
paragraphs.3: In operative paragraph 1, replace “Welcomes” with “Takes note of”.
paragraphs.5: In operative paragraph 14, replace “Strengthening of international cooperation and coordination of efforts to study, mitigate and minimize the consequences of the Chornobyl disaster” with “Strengthening of international cooperation and coordination of efforts to study, mitigate and minimize the consequences of the Chernobyl disaster”. * Any changes to the list of sponsors will be reflected in the official record of the meeting.
